title: Drawing, "Harold S. Anderson House: Chair", February 19, 1937
medium: Graphite, black ink, and red color pencil on tracing paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: DONALD DESKEY/630 FIFTH AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite in stamp, lower right: 8560/F.S./ANDERSON, OLSSON/DILLMANN/D./2/19/37, 3/3/37, 1, MASTERCRAFTSMAN; inscribed in graphite, left of stamp: MAKE 12 LIKE THIS/STRAIGHT GRAIN SOLID WOOD TO MATCH/MACASSAR WHEN FINISHED/NOTE! MAKE ONE MODEL CHAIR FOR APPROVAL/BEFORE PROCEEDING WITH BALANCE OF CHAIRS; dimensions, materials, instructions in graphite
description: Perspective, plan, and elevation drawings for upholstered armchair. Tub chair with four straight legs. Back and arms in one piece and upholstered; wood extending from arms to form front legs. Padded, upholstered seat with rounded front. Twelve chairs in commission; in macassar ebony.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Harold S. Anderson House: Chair", February 19, 1937.
February 19, 1937. Graphite, black ink, and red color pencil on tracing paper. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-967.
